geeklist.title: Geeklist Import Example
geeklist.description: This is a Geek List that is used as an example for being able to import by Geek List ID. Tried to stick with a theme of Dungeon Crawlers/Miniatures Games

item.body: Game play mechanics make this a great Dungeon Crawler but the theme is kinda off putting. Lots of minis!
It's an interesting Dungeon Crawler with some fun mechanics but needs a few house rules to increase the pressure of being in the dungeon
Kill Zombies. Get Loot. Very Simple and an easy gateway to Dungeon Crawlers
A lot of Dungeon fits into this tiny little box
If you like Heavy, Chunky Games and Love Batman, boy do I have good news for you. I am afraid to break the shrink wrap on this one
More puzzle than Dungeon Crawler. Really want to get to the Table but a bit Difficult to get a consistent group going

item.objectname: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Adventures: Change is Constant
item.body: Mechanics really highlight how teamwork should go. Downside is that while it IS a complete game, really needs City Fall to feel Complete. Shame company went out of business

item.objectname: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Adventures: City Fall
item.body: Mechanics really highlight how teamwork should go. Downside is that while it IS a complete game, really needs Change is Constant to feel Complete. Shame company went out of business

item.objectname: Batman: The Animated Series Adventures â€“ Shadow of the Bat
item.body: Same mechanics engine as TMNT City Fall and Change is constant so characters could be mixed and matched. Did someone say Crossover?
Havent even hit the tip of the iceberg with Glomhaven, but sure, here is another Massive Campaign Crawler I should own!
I like the spiral notebook maps as opposed to the multiple tiles. Makes for easier set up. Told this was an easier introduction to the series

item.objectname: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
item.body: This is the epitome of the Dungeon Crawler in my opinion. Heard Good Things about the 3rd Edition too but not sure I want to crack THAT can of wyrms.

Built on the Descent 2e Engine, this is a GREAT Dungeon Crawler but Star Wars. Fantastic accompanying app to go along with it. Love the Imperial Twists and surprises mid game. Really should knock the dust off this one soon
